person.content:
Please identify the "Person" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Four African states are ready to nominate candidates for the post of U.N. secretary-general on Friday now that Boutros Boutros-Ghali has temporarily put aside his bid for re-election .

Let's think step by step.

1. Boutros Boutros-Ghali
2. Four African states

These are the entities identified as "Person" in the given paragraph. Boutros Boutros-Ghali is a specific individual, while "Four African states" is a collective entity representing multiple states.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Person.

1. Boutros Boutros-Ghali
2. Four African states (representing the states that will be nominating candidates)

These are the entities that clearly refer to persons in the given paragraph. "Four African states" is a collective entity representing multiple states, but it is still considered a person for the purpose of this context as it is taking an action (nominating candidates).

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Person".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Person |
|--------|
| Boutros Boutros-Ghali |
| Four African states |

These are the entities that clearly refer to persons in the given paragraph, presented in a Markdown table format with one column labeled "Person". "Four African states" is included as a collective entity representing multiple states, as it is taking an action (nominating candidates) in the context of the paragraph.

location.content:

Paragraph: Four African states are ready to nominate candidates for the post of U.N. secretary-general on Friday now that Boutros Boutros-Ghali has temporarily put aside his bid for re-election .

1. Africa (four African states are from this continent)
2. United Nations (UN) (the organization where the secretary-general serves)
3. Egypt (implied, as Boutros Boutros-Ghali is from this country)
